Did not think I would enjoy this game this much. You deserve praise

competition against friends, stats, leaderboard? Maybe a larger map? I know

successful experience as a company. Wish you guys the best thank you for 
making a great game.
replyContent:
Hi Darklyger64,

Thank you so much for your review, you make very good points! It also makes us very happy to hear that you're enjoying BATTLESHIP as much as we enjoy developing it.
I have passed your feedback along to our design team for discussion!
We hope you enjoy our upcoming update.

it doesn't sync between devices. It doesn't sign in to my Google Play 
account so when I opened it on my tablet my stats were back at zero on that 
device. Second, along with multiplayer I hope in the future to play private 
games with a friend. Be it through Google Play or Facebook. I'd like to 
pick my opponent. Add these and I'll give five stars.

instance, I've played about 10 games at the Montevideo arena, and still 
need the experience for "Play 2 games at Montevideo arena". Also, get rid 
of the animation between turns, at least in single player games. This only 
makes it frustrating. I can take a turn in half a second, wait 2 seconds 
between turns, then the enemy takes a half second turn. Makes the game last 
3 times as long, for nothing.

It's OK, but the cpu cheats very badly or is just extremely lucky. I 
downloaded it for free, but if you want the extra stuff of course you have 
to pay for it which kinda sucks. Overall it's a great time killer but could 
use some improvements.

It does what it is supposed to do. Fine graphics. Hard to exit (Android's 
back button does not work in the game).

Classic Battleship, including the good ol' boys motif. (Seriously, I have 
to *pay* to play as the only available female character? Oh, and all of 
them are white.) Graphics are decent and gameplay is fun. At first I 
thought the AI was cheating on easy mode as others have said by hitting the 
middle of a ship and then either side of the hit until the ship has sunk, 
but then I realized that's a strategy I used to beat my kid sister when we 
played the game in elementary school. Still, Marmalade should fix it the AI 
so it doesn't act so predictably. Medals and goals give the game some nice 
replay value. Combat mode has new ships and play strategies for an 
interesting twist. Controlling placement of the ships is quirky - I keep 
dropping them outside the grid accidentally. Also, the huge "YOUR TURN" 
banner that flashes across the screen is tr√® obnoxious, especially given 
that the game usually takes me 30+ turns to complete. As others have said, 
there are currently few extras: two additional non-animated backgrounds for 
99¬¢ each; two additional characters - including the only female in the game 
- at $1.99 per. My hope is that if this game takes off like Marmalade's 
excellent Clue, more characters (including more diversity), more 
backgrounds, and maybe even more extras will be available. Oh, and that the 
"YOUR TURN" banner will drown in the Baltic Sea. (Edited for grammar and to 
add more info.)
Fun old classic BATTLESHIP
Implimentation is ok but God I forgot how boring this game is. (Yawn. )
Tracks user data with Sh*tbook.

Overall it's good. But in classic single mode the "easy" setting needs 
fixed. I played at least 3 games in a row and lost miserably. The computer 
would hit in the middle. Go one way and finish that end. Then turn and go 
the other way without missing once.

Matchmaking sucks. Half the time the other player never clicks "ready." I 
ALWAYS get paired with "WeirdRabbit948," which must be some bot that just 
sits in the lobby. There should be a way to block/report players. Also, I'd 
like to play against people I know, but that's not an option... And then 
there's the fact that this is a paid game, but there's still in app 
purchases required for unlocked features. Bottom line, it's a great 
concept, but poorly executed. For that reason, I have to uninstall.

Great game! Most fun when in multiplayer, especially if you are playing 
against someone who's right next to you. The Commanders Mode finally put 
Battleship on the 21st century, made it interesting and most importantly 
FUN!

It doesn't allow you to play with friends which on that alone makes it lose 
most its appeal and when you lose it doesn't show the enemy board either. 
Which makes the game kinda boring and pointless.

Nothing particularly enhanced in their "commanders" version. Lots of 
options locked behind In-App Purchase. A pretty disappointment.

To be blunt, this game sucks. The AI cheats sometimes - often, it will hit 
the middle of my ship, then hit one side and hit the next side. There's no 
way it could know exactly where my ship tiles are from hitting the middle. 
It's also very plain and doesn't offer much. I got it for free (thank God!) 
but I'm still very disappointed that they put in-app purchases in a paid 
game. If you get this, I hope you don't mind only having 2 captains and 2 
"levels" (this app's sorry excuse for "levels" is two different backgrounds 
you can pick from and 2 more than can be bought for $1 each. What a rip 
off. I'd be ashamed of myself if I had my name on this garbage.

This app is so plain. You can NOT play with your friends/family! There is 
no store/deals! There seems to be some cheating of some sort! This is an 
unfinished app. Please fix the problems!

Paid game with IAP. Absolutely disappointed. You have to pay money to buy 
it and pay even more money inside the game.

I want to see the final board of the match of the enemy placement when I 
lose a match. Stupid that it goes straight to the score screen.
Plays like the classic game.
Fun - in app purchases are pricey

Not at all like the advertising video. It could not be any more plain and 
boring. Waste of money which I would like to be returned.
replyContent: Hi Todd Ragsdale. We are sorry to hear you feel that way. At the moment Battleship does not have any advertising video but we are happy to tell you that it will be released in the near future. If there is anything we can help you with, please feel free to send us an email to contactus@marmalademail.com

content:
A great official version of the classic game. I have no complaints. Plays 
well and is challenging.
Be nice if it would even install
Won't get past the loading screen after Marmalade's logo. Freezes everytime.

Well it sucks CPU is competent, however the cheat, as in half way through 
it ignores your picks for targets. As in you pick a spot and it ignores 
your input until you select ba miss square then proceeds. Sadly I paid for 
this game. Truly wish 5here was a buyer's remorse ability and if after 
playing for 15 to 30 min you can refund your purchase
Not bad... But at least give us the option to create our own name...

Nice to see an official mobile edition of this classic games cabinet 
standard, especially from my favorite interpreters of Hasbro's catalog. 
Classic gameplay is smooth & straightforward, but as a whole the app still 
feels like a work in progress. Taps on the commander selection screen don't 
always register. There's no option for signing in with Facebook, so we're 
all saddled with bizarre random player IDs for now. A dedicated shop for 
IAPs would be nice, as well as some kind of rules screens or tutorial for 
navigating the new features of the mobile game. Much like the developer's 
Clue and Life apps, I'm sure Battleship will become more refined with each 
update.

"No connection. Internet connection required to play." I just downloaded 
the game using my internet connection...
Just need to be able to write my own name on the profile

Awesome, some great new twists and cool features in Commanders mode make 
this super addictive
The game wont even work on my phone it's rubbish i want my money back
